member.name: M:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.IFactory.CreateComment(System.String,System.Boolean,Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.CommentParentType,Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.FieldProperties[],System.String,Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.CommentMergeFlags)
member.summary: For details please refer to respective overloaded method

member.name: M:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.IFactory.CreateComment(System.String,System.Boolean,Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.ErrorCode@,Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.CommentParentType,Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.FieldProperties[],System.String,Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.CommentMergeFlags)
member.param: [in] text pointer to text for comment; can be null (treated equal to empty text). This can be a plain text or text with encoded information, e.g. from an existing comment. This text will be updated or merged, depending on the options and the other parameters. For MDF 4.x encoded information requires an XML fragment (parameter isXml = true), whereas for MDF 3.x also non-XML text may contain encoded information. In case of an XML fragment it should be valid XML and match the schema for the designated parent object and the respective MDF version of the file.
[in] if true, the given text is an XML fragment, otherwise plain text. Must be false for MDF 3.x.
[out] returns the error code for the operation

[in] type of parent object the comment should be assigned to. See CommentParentType. Only relevant for MDF 4.x in case comment fields must be encoded, otherwise it can be set to ::eCommentParentTypeUnspec. Note: when creating a file comment for MDF 3.x, please specify ::eCommentParentFile to avoid using reserved field names for standard fields. Or, better, use IFile::SetCommentTextAndFields.
[in] array with comment fields and their properties; can be null if no list is specified.
[in] plain comment text to set (i.e. in <TX> tag for MDF 4.x); can be null to keep the original text. See CommentMergeFlags for further details.

[in] bit flags for merging existing information with new information, see CommentMergeFlags. Attributes in MDF4 are only replaced for an already existing field if the attribute value is not null (for unit, desc, lang) or ::eFieldDataTypeUnspec (for type). Note: In MDF 4.x, existing fields are only possible if isXml is true.
member.returns: pointer to IComment object, null on error

member.name: T:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.IFactory
member.summary:
Factory object for creation of sharable objects in the file.
The IFactory object serves to create new "sharable" objects. Sharable objects are objects that may be used by several other objects.
The following objects are sharable:
IComment
IUnit
IConversion
ISourceInfo
After creation of the sharable object, the object must be assigned to some other object in the file. This can be done using one of the Set methods (e.g. IFile::SetComment) or in one of the other creation methods (e.g. IFile::CreateChannelGroup).
Access to the IFactory object is provided by IFile::GetFactory. It is only available for newly created files (with IFileMananger::CreateFile) or for files opened for modification (see IFileMananger::OpenFile).

member.name: M:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.ICommentNode.GetPtr
member.summary: Used to get underlying C++ pointer

summary.para: Description of a node in hierarchy of comment fields

The ICommentNode object describes a node for a comment field hierarchy (tree/list).
For MDF 4.x, the <common_properties> tag in XML may define a list of comment fields (<e> tag for single key-value pair or <elist> tag for a field with multiple values) or also a hierarchical structure of these fields (<tree> and <list> tags).
For MDF 3.x, there can be only a flat list of comment fields (Vector proprietary extension). For both cases, a "root" node is modeled for the flat list of comment fields (ICommentField objects).
Note: <list> and <elist> tags are only available in MDF 4.1 or higher.

member.name: M:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.ICommentField.GetPtr
member.summary: Used to get underlying C++ pointer

summary.para: Description of a comment field

The ICommentField object describes a custom field of a comment.
For MDF 4.x, these are <e> or <elist> tags in XML comment (below <common_properties> tag).
For MDF 3.x comment fields are encoded in a proprietary format in the text comment.
Note: <elist> tags are only available in MDF 4.1 or higher. They are similar to <e> tags, but can store a list of values.

member.name: M:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.IComment.GetPtr
member.summary: Used to get underlying C++ pointer

summary.para: Comment of some other object
The IComment object contains the comment text of some other object. It can be a plain text or (for MDF4) also an XML fragment.

Apart from a plain text, each comment may contain additional information encoded in XML (MDF 4.x) or in a Vector proprietary encoding (MDF 3.x). This information may contain so-called "Comment fields" which are the most common way to store custom information in MDF that is generally readable. Comment fields store custom information as key-value pairs. MDF 4.x even offers hierarchical structure of these fields using tree or list nodes (MDF 4.x).
In MDF4 Lib, comment fields are modelled by ICommentField objects that can be accessed via IComment::GetCommentFieldSet().
In order to create IComment objects with comment fields, either use IFactory::CreateCommentEx() or (only for file comment) IFile::SetCommentTextAndFields.

member.summary: Get a sub set with all channels matching the given parameters
member.param: [in] name of channel to find. If the eUseChannelNameAsMask bit is set in filterFlags, the string is a search mask with wild cards. The wildcards can be ? (question mark character) for any single character and * (asterisk character) for any number of various characters.

[in] if given, the extended name prefix also must match (see IChannel::GetExtendedNamePrefix). Default: null. If the eUseNamePrefixAsMask bit is set in filterFlags, the string is a search mask with wild cards. Like for channelName, the wildcards can be ? (question mark character) for any single character and * (asterisk character) for any number of various characters. If the eAcceptIfNoExtension bit is set in options, channels without an extended name prefix are accepted.
[in] flags for filtering default is eSubSetFilterFlagsUnspecified, value is a bit combination of ::ChannelSubSetFilterFlags. Default: eSubSetFilterFlagsUnspecified
[out] error code of the operation will be returned
member.returns: IChannelSet object, null on error

member.name: M:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.IChannelSet.GetChannelByName(System.String,Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.ErrorCode@)

summary.para: Get first channel from set that matches the given name.

Note: this method uses case-sensitive comparison. For case-insensitive comparison use GetChannelSubSet() with flag ::eCompareNoCase.
If ::eUseBinarySearchForChannelName has been specified for Get(Child)ChannelSet method (or ::eUseBinarySearchForResultSet for GetChannelSubSet()), this method uses a binary search to find the channel name. In this case the first call to GetChannelName() takes longer because all channels first must be sorted according to their names. If there are several channel with equal name, the binary search will find one of them but not necessarily the first one.

member.param: channelName name of channel to find.
error code of the operation will be returned.
member.returns: return pointer to IChannel object, null on error

member.summary: Get number of channels in set

summary.para: Collection of channels
The IChannelSet object contains a number of channels.
It can be used to filter channels from a file, a channel group, or from the children of a channel (i.e. structure members or array elements).
The channels can be accessed by zero-based index in the set or by name.
A further method filters the channels from the set into a new subset.

member.name: M:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.IChannelGroup.CreateDataWriter(Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.ErrorCode@,System.UInt32,Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.ZipTypeAndLevel)

summary.para: Create a data writer object to write signal values for this channel group

note: for MDF3, any other operation that creates a new object and writes it to file (e.g. IFacotry::CreateComment or IFile::CreateChannelGroup) is only allowed after the IDataWriter has been released!
Only one IDataWriter can be open per file, i.e. creating a new IDataWriter will fail as long as another one is open and has not been released yet.
It is also not allowed to create an IDataWriter as long as there is an open data pointer (IDataPointer/IGroupDataPointer) using this channel group.

member.param: [out] returns the error code for the operation. Default: null

[in] number of records to store in internal write buffer before flushing to file (MDF4 only, will be ignored for MDF3). If 0, the number of records to buffer will be determined internally (default) If 1, each single record will be written to file immediately (bad performance, should only be used for large or VLSD records).
[in] type and level of compression algorithm to use, see ZipTypeAndLevel. Must be eNoCompression for MDF < 4.1.
member.returns: on success the IDataWriter interface of the created data writer, otherwise null

member.summary: For details please refer to overloaded method
For details please refer to overloaded method

summary.para: Create a stream synchronization channel in this channel group
The given channel will be appended to the channel list of this channel group.

Please pay attention that the added channel can be identified uniquely within the channel group, otherwise the method might fail with eNoUniqueIdentification. For MDF4 the combination of channel name (cn), source name (cs) and source path (cp) (see GetSourceInfo) must be unique.

Adding a channel, the range of data Bytes and possibly invalidation Bytes (MDF4) will be extended considering the range of Bytes used by the added channel. Hence, adding a channel that exceeds the current record length of the channel group is only possible as long as the channel group has no records (GetSampleCount() must be 0) and no IDataWriter for the channel group is open.
note: only available for newly created or writable file.

member.param: [in] name for the channel.
[in] byte offset of the channel value in the record data bytes.
[in] pointer to IAttachment object with stream to be synchronized (must not be null). Note: attachment object must be in same file and in global list of attachments.

[in] type of synchronization with the stream in attachment, see SyncType. Only values eTimeSync, eAngleSync, eDistanceSync, and eIndexSync are allowed. Note: Physical values of this channel must return the unit of the respective synchronization domain, i.e. seconds for syncType = eTimeSync, or an index value for syncType = eIndexSync. These values are used for synchronization with the stream.
[in] number of bits used for the channel value in the record data bytes. Default is 32.

[in] data type of the channel (default = eInteger_Unsigned_LE), see ChannelDataType. For this channel type, only numeric data types are allowed. If number of bits does not match the data type, the method will fail with error code eInvalidDataTypeSize.
[in] pointer to IComment object to set for the channel. Note: object must be in same file and if comment is XML for MDF4, it should match the respective XML schema (cn_comment.XSD).
[in] pointer to IUnit object to set for the channel. Note: object must be in same file and if unit is XML for MDF4, it should match the respective XML schema (cn_unit.XSD).
[in] pointer to IConversion object to set for the channel. Note: object must be in same file and the conversion type must match the channel data type.
[in] pointer to ISourceInfo object to set for the channel. Note: object must be in same file.

[in] bit flags to set for the channel, see ChannelFlags. Note: flags eFlagPrecisionValid, eFlagValueRangeValid, eFlagLimitRangeValid, eFlagLimitExtRangeValid and eFlagDefaultX will be ignored (reset) use the respective Set methods instead to set the information.
[in] position of invalidation bit. Will only be considered for MDF4 and if eFlagInvalBitUsed flag is set in flags.
[out] the error code of the operation will be returned
member.returns: on success the IChannel interface of the created master channel, otherwise null

The given channel will be appended to the channel list of this channel group.

Please pay attention that the added channel can be identified uniquely within the channel group, otherwise the method might fail with eNoUniqueIdentification. For MDF4 the combination of channel name (cn), source name (cs) and source path (cp) (see GetSourceInfo) must be unique.

Adding a channel, the range of data Bytes and possibly invalidation Bytes (MDF4) will be extended considering the range of Bytes used by the added channel. [in] pointer to IConversion object to set for the channel. Note: object must be in same file and the conversion type must match the channel data type.
[in] channelSource pointer to ISourceInfo object to set for the channel. Note: object must be in same file.

[in] bit flags to set for the channel, see ChannelFlags. Note: flags eFlagPrecisionValid, eFlagValueRangeValid, eFlagLimitRangeValid, eFlagLimitExtRangeValid and eFlagDefaultX will be ignored (reset) use the respective Set methods instead to set the information.
[in] position of invalidation bit. Will only be considered for MDF4 and if eFlagInvalBitUsed flag is set in flags. Default is 0.
[out] the error code of the operation will be returned
member.returns: on success the IChannel interface of the created channel, otherwise null

summary.para: Create a variable length data channel in this channel group
The given channel will be appended to the channel list of this channel group.

Please pay attention that the added channel can be identified uniquely within the channel group, otherwise the method might fail with eNoUniqueIdentification. For MDF4 the combination of channel name (cn), source name (cs) and source path (cp) (see GetSourceInfo) must be unique.

Adding a channel, the range of data Bytes and possibly invalidation Bytes (MDF4) will be extended considering the range of Bytes used by the added channel (here 8 Bytes always). Hence, adding a channel that exceeds the current record length of the channel group is only possible as long as the channel group has no records (GetSampleCount() must be 0) and no IDataWriter for the channel group is open.
note: only available for newly created or writable file, not available for MDF3

member.param: [in] name for the channel.
[in] byte offset of the channel value in the record data bytes.

[in] data type of the channel, see ChannelDataType. Default is eByteArray, For VLSD channels, the data type specifies the type of the VLSD values. Typically only string or complex data types are used for VLSD channels.
[in] pointer to IComment object to set for the channel. Note: object must be in same file and if comment is XML for MDF4, it should match the respective XML schema (cn_comment.XSD).
[in] pointer to IUnit object to set for the channel. Note: object must be in same file and if unit is XML for MDF4, it should match the respective XML schema (cn_unit.XSD).
[in] pointer to IConversion object to set for the channel. Note: object must be in same file and the conversion type must match the channel data type.
[in] pointer to ISourceInfo object to set for the channel. Note: object must be in same file.

[in] bit flags to set for the channel, see ChannelFlags. Note: flags eFlagPrecisionValid, eFlagValueRangeValid, eFlagLimitRangeValid, eFlagLimitExtRangeValid and eFlagDefaultX will be ignored (reset) use the respective Set methods instead to set the information.
[in] position of invalidation bit. Will only be considered for MDF4 and if eFlagInvalBitUsed flag is set in flags. Default is 0.
[out] the error code of the operation will be returned
member.returns: on success the IChannel interface of the created channel, otherwise null

summary.para: Create a fixed length data channel in this channel group
The given channel will be appended to the channel list of this channel group.

Please pay attention that the added channel can be identified uniquely within the channel group, otherwise the method might fail with eNoUniqueIdentification. For MDF4 the combination of channel name (cn), source name (cs) and source path (cp) (see GetSourceInfo) must be unique.

Adding a channel, the range of data Bytes and possibly invalidation Bytes (MDF4) will be extended considering the range of Bytes used by the added channel. Hence, adding a channel that exceeds the current record length of the channel group is only possible as long as the channel group has no records (GetSampleCount() must be 0) and no IDataWriter for the channel group is open.
note: only available for newly created or writable file.

member.param: [in] name for the channel.
[in] byte offset of the channel value in the record data bytes.
[in] number of bits used for the channel value in the record data bytes. Default 64, if 0, a virtual data channel will be created (MDF 4.1)
[in] data type of the channel, see ChannelDataType. Default eReal_LE, If number of bits does not match the data type, the method will fail with error code eInvalidDataTypeSize.
[in] pointer to IComment object to set for the channel. Note: object must be in same file and if comment is XML for MDF4, it should match the respective XML schema (cn_comment.XSD).
[in] pointer to IUnit object to set for the channel. Note: object must be in same file and if unit is XML for MDF4, it should match the respective XML schema (cn_unit.XSD).
[in] pointer to IConversion object to set for the channel. Note: object must be in same file and the conversion type must match the channel data type.
[in] pointer to ISourceInfo object to set for the channel. Note: object must be in same file.

[in] bit flags to set for the channel, see ChannelFlags. Note: flags eFlagPrecisionValid, eFlagValueRangeValid, eFlagLimitRangeValid, eFlagLimitExtRangeValid and eFlagDefaultX will be ignored (reset) use the respective Set methods instead to set the information.
[in] position of invalidation bit. Will only be considered for MDF4 and if eFlagInvalBitUsed flag is set in flags.
[in] bit offset of the channel value in the data bytes of the parent channel. 0-7, must be 0 for all data types >= eReal_LE.
[out] the error code of the operation will be returned
member.returns: on success the IChannel interface of the created master channel, otherwise null

member.name: M:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.IChannelGroup.CreateMasterChannel(System.String,System.UInt32,System.UInt32,Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.ChannelDataType)
member.summary: For details please refer to respective overloaded method

summary.para: Create a master channel in this channel group
The given channel will be appended to the channel list of this channel group.

note: There can be at most one master channel (real or virtual) per sync type per channel group. Adding a second master channel with the same sync type will fail with error code eNoUniqueMasterChannel. For the created master channel automatically a IUnit will be added with name "s", "m" or "rad", depending on the sync type.

Please pay attention that the added channel can be identified uniquely within the channel group, otherwise the method might fail with eNoUniqueIdentification. For MDF4 the combination of channel name (cn), source name (cs) and source path (cp) (see GetSourceInfo) must be unique.

Adding a channel, the range of data Bytes and possibly invalidation Bytes (MDF4) will be extended considering the range of Bytes used by the added channel. Hence, adding a channel that exceeds the current record length of the channel group is only possible as long as the channel group has no records (GetSampleCount() must be 0) and no IDataWriter for the channel group is open.
note: only available for newly created or writable file.

member.param: [in] name for the master channel. If null, depending on the sync type automatically the name "time", "angle" or "distance" will be set.
[in] byte offset of the channel value in the record data bytes.
[in] number of bits used for the channel value in the record data bytes. if 0, a virtual master channel will be created.

[in] data type of the channel, see ChannelDataType. For this channel type, only numeric data types are allowed. If number of bits does not match the data type, the method will fail with error code eInvalidDataTypeSize.
[in] synchronization type (default = eTimeSync) of the master channel, see SyncType. Only values eTimeSync, eAngleSync, and eDistanceSync are allowed.
[in] pointer to IComment object to set for the channel. Note: object must be in same file and if comment is XML for MDF4, it should match the respective XML schema (cn_comment.XSD).
[in] pointer to IUnit object to set for the channel. Note: object must be in same file and if unit is XML for MDF4, it should match the respective XML schema (cn_unit.XSD).
[in] pointer to IConversion object to set for the channel. Note: object must be in same file and the conversion type must match the channel data type.
[in] channelSource pointer to ISourceInfo object to set for the channel. Note: object must be in same file.
[out] the error code of the operation will be returned
member.returns: on success the IChannel interface of the created master channel, otherwise null

member.summary: For details please refer to respective overloaded method

member.name: M:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.IChannelGroup.CreateMasterChannel(System.String,System.UInt32,System.Double,System.UInt32,Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.ChannelDataType,Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.SyncType,Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.IComment,Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.ErrorCode@)

summary.para: Create a master channel in this channel group
The given channel will be appended to the channel list of this channel group.

note: There can be at most one master channel (real or virtual) per sync type per channel group. Adding a second master channel with the same sync type will fail with error code eNoUniqueMasterChannel. For the created master channel automatically a IUnit will be added with name "s", "m" or "rad", depending on the sync type.
Please pay attention that the added channel can be identified uniquely within the channel group, otherwise the method might fail with eNoUniqueIdentification.
For MDF4 the combination of channel name (cn), source name (cs) and source path (cp) (see GetSourceInfo) must be unique.
Adding a channel, the range of data Bytes and possibly invalidation Bytes (MDF4) will be extended considering the range of Bytes used by the added channel.

Hence, adding a channel that exceeds the current record length of the channel group is only possible as long as the channel group has no records (GetSampleCount() must be 0) and no IDataWriter for the channel group is open.
note: only available for newly created or writable file.

member.param: [in] name for the master channel. If null, depending on the sync type automatically the name "time", "angle" or "distance" will be set.
[in] byte offset of the channel value in the record data bytes.

[in] factor for a linear conversion (offset 0) of the master channel. Must be >= 0, default = 1.0 If conversionFactor is different to 1, the method automatically creates or assigns a respective IConversion.
[in] number of bits used for the channel value in the record data bytes. Default is 64. if 0, a virtual master channel will be created.

[in] data type of the channel (default = eReal_LE), see ChannelDataType. For this channel type, only numeric data types are allowed. If number of bits does not match the data type, the method will fail with error code eInvalidDataTypeSize.
[in] synchronization type (default = eTimeSync) of the master channel, see SyncType. Only values eTimeSync, eAngleSync, and eDistanceSync are allowed.
[in] pointer to IComment object to set for the channel. Note: object must be in same file and if comment is XML for MDF4, it should match the respective XML schema (cn_comment.XSD).
[out] the error code of the operation will be returned
member.returns: on success the IChannel interface of the created master channel, otherwise null

summary.para: Description of a channel group
The IChannelGroup object describes a channel group (CG block) and also holds some information of the data group (DG block).
A channel group contains a collection of channels which are stored in one record, i.e. which have equal sampling.

member.summary: Get start addresses of CN block
member.returns: start address of CN block for this channel (for arrays the template CN), -1 on error.

member.name: M:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.IChannel.SetName(System.String)

summary.para: Set/change the name of the channel.
Note: only available for newly created or writable file, not available for array child channels in MDF4 files.
Typically the name of a channel is fixed.

For a possible use case for changing the name consider that the channel contains wrong signal values that should be corrected. If this cannot be achieved simply by assigning a new conversion rule (e.g. linear or value2value conversion), then a possible solution might be to rename the channel and to create a new channel (in a new channel group) with the original channel name and with corrected values.
Currently this requires duplication of all master channels in the new channel group, in a future MDF version there might be an alternative solution by only referencing the original channel group.

member.param: [in] string to be used as name (must not be empty!).
member.returns: error code for the operation.

member.name: M:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.IChannel.ConvertToArray(System.UInt16,System.UInt64[])
member.summary: For details please refer to overloaded method

member.name: M:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.IChannel.ConvertToArray(System.UInt16,System.UInt64[],Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.ArrayType,Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.ArrayPropertyFlags,System.Int32,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Convert this channel to an array of channels note: only available for newly created or writable file and for fixed-length value channels (channel type ::eFixedLength). Currently not available for MDF 3.x and for array or structure child channels or structures or arrays. The current channel will be used as "template" for creating an array of channels where each element channel has the same properties except that the byte offset and (if used) the invalidation bit position varies. The composition type of the parent channel will be changed to ::eIsArray.
member.param: [in] number of dimensions for the array (must be > 0)
[in] array with size (number of elements) for each dimension. dimSizeArray must not be null and must have at least dimCount elements. Each size value must be > 0.
[in] type of the array, default (eIsValueArray) see ArrayType. Note: if an array of arrays is created, the main array must have the same type as the sub array.

[in] bit flags for the array properties, default (eArrayPropertyUnspecified) see ArrayPropertyFlags. Note: flags ::eHasDynamicSize, ::eHasInputQuantity, ::eHasOutputQuantity, ::eHasComparisonQuantity and ::eHasAxis only prepare the array that these properties are available. However, each property (e.g. axis) must be set individually by getting the IArrayInfo objects with GetArrayInfo and using the respective Set methods.

[in] Base factor for calculation of byte offsets for each element channel from the template channel (this channel). Default is 0. If byteOffsetBase is 0, then the byte offset is used from the size in bytes of the element channels, i.e. component values are stored contiguously (next to each other without gaps). If byteOffsetBase is not 0, then its absolute value should be larger than or equal to the size in bytes of the element channels. If byteOffsetBase is negative, the component values are stored with decreasing index.

[in] Base factor for calculation of invalidation bit positions for each element channel from the template channel (this channel). Default is 0. Note: only used if template channel uses invalidation bits (see ::eFlagInvalBitUsed). If invalBitPosBase is 0, then all element channels use the same invalidation bit in the record, i.e. either all are valid or all are invalid. If invalBitPosBase > 0, each element channel will have its own invalidation bit. If invalBitPosBase is 1, then the individual invalidation bits are stored without gaps.
member.returns: error code of the operation

member.name: M:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.IChannel.ReadPhysRange(System.Double@,System.Double@)

summary.para: Read physical value range of channel
Usually the physical value range stored in the conversion rule assigned to the channel will be returned.
In case the physical value range of the conversion rule is not available, but the raw value range of the channel is valid:
a. If the channel has no conversion rule, the raw value range will be returned.
b. If the conversion rule does not return a numeric type, the raw value range will be returned and the return value will be eInvalidConversionType.
c. In all other cases, the raw value range will be converted using the conversion rule:
1. On a conversion error, the return value will be the error code of the conversion operation.
2. On success it will be either eOK or eConversionNotMonotone to indicate that the phys value range may not be correct because the conversion may not be monotone.

member.param: [out] min the minimum physical value of the range will be assigned
[out] max the maximum physical value of the range will be assigned
member.returns: error code of the operation

member.name: M:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.IChannel.SetPhysRange(System.Double,System.Double,System.Boolean)

summary.para: Set physical value range of channel
note: only available for newly created or writable file, not available for array child channels in MDF4 files
Set the minimum and maximum physical value that occurred for the signal.
For arrays, the minimum and maximum value is calculated over all elements.
note: range should only be set if conversion rule is used exclusively for this channel.

member.param: [in] min minimum physical value
[in] max maximum physical value
[in] isValid false if physical range is invalid, true if valid (default)
member.returns: error code of the operation

member.name: M:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.IChannel.CreateChildVLSDChannel(System.String,System.UInt32,Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.ChannelDataType,Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.IComment,Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.IUnit,Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.IConversion,Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.ChannelFlags,System.UInt32,Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.ErrorCode@)

summary.para: Create a variable length data channel as structure child member of this channel

A sub channel can only be created for a parent channel with fixed length data type eByteArray that is not an array (composition type != eIsArray) or an array member (component type != eIsArrayElement). In case, the composition type of the parent channel will be changed to eIsStruct. Note that the structure child member will automatically have the same source information as the parent channel.
note: only available for newly created or writable file, not available for MDF3

member.param: [in] name name for the channel.
[in] relativeByteOffset byte offset of the channel value in the data bytes of the parent channel.

[in] channelDataType (default value = eByteArray) data type of the channel For VLSD channels, the data type specifies the type of the VLSD values. Typically only string or complex data types are used for VLSD channels.

[in] comment (default value = null) object of type IComment to set for the channel. Note: object must be in same file and if comment is XML for MDF4, it should match the respective XML schema (cn_comment.XSD).
[in] unit (default value = null) object of type IUnit to set for the channel. Note: object must be in same file and if unit is XML for MDF4, it should match the respective XML schema (cn_unit.XSD).
[in] conversion (default value = null) object of type IConversion to set for the channel. Note: object must be in same file and the conversion type must match the channel data type.

[in] flags (default value = eFlagAllValuesInvalid) bit flags to set for the channel Note: flags eFlagPrecisionValid, eFlagValueRangeValid, eFlagLimitRangeValid, eFlagLimitExtRangeValid and eFlagDefaultX will be ignored (reset) use the respective Set methods instead to set the information.
[in] invalBitPos (default value = 0) position of invalidation bit. Will only be considered for MDF4 and if eFlagInvalBitUsed flag is set in flags.
[out] errorCode contains the error code of the operation
member.returns: on success the IChannel interface of the created master channel, otherwise null

summary.para: Create a maximum length data channel as structure child member of this channel

A sub channel can only be created for a parent channel with fixed length data type eByteArray that is not an array (composition type != eIsArray) or an array member (component type != eIsArrayElement). In case, the composition type of the parent channel will be changed to eIsStruct. Note that the structure child member will automatically have the same source information as the parent channel.
note: only available for newly created or writable file, not available for MDF3

member.param: [in] name name for the sub channel.
[in] relativeByteOffset byte offset of the channel value in the data bytes of the parent channel. Note: the byte offset within the record of the channel group will be calculated internally!

[in] sizeChannel pointer to IChannel object for the size signal of the MLSD channel. Note: object must be in same file and channel group and should return as physical values only integer values <= maxByteCount.
[in] maxByteCount maximum number of Bytes for MLSD channel value, i.e. number of Bytes used for the channel value in the record data bytes.

[in] dataType (default value = eByteArray) data type of the channel Typically only string or complex data types are used for MLSD channels. If number of bits does not match the data type, the method will fail with error code eInvalidDataTypeSize.

[in] comment (default value = null) object of type IComment to set for the channel. Note: object must be in same file and if comment is XML for MDF4, it should match the respective XML schema (cn_comment.XSD).
[in] unit (default value = null) object of type IUnit to set for the channel. Note: object must be in same file and if unit is XML for MDF4, it should match the respective XML schema (cn_unit.XSD).
[in] conversion (default value = null) object of type IConversion to set for the channel. Note: object must be in same file and the conversion type must match the channel data type.

[in] flags (default value = eFlagAllValuesInvalid) bit flags to set for the channel Note: flags eFlagPrecisionValid, eFlagValueRangeValid, eFlagLimitRangeValid, eFlagLimitExtRangeValid and eFlagDefaultX will be ignored (reset) use the respective Set methods instead to set the information.
[in] invalBitPos (default value = 0) position of invalidation bit. Will only be considered for MDF4 and if eFlagInvalBitUsed flag is set in flags.
[out] errorCode contains the error code of the operation
member.returns: on success the IChannel interface of the created master channel, otherwise null

summary.para: Create a fixed length data channel as structure child member of this channel

A sub channel can only be created for a parent channel with fixed length data type eByteArray that is not an array (composition type != eIsArray) or an array member (component type != eIsArrayElement). In case, the composition type of the parent channel will be changed to eIsStruct. Note that the structure child member will automatically have the same source information as the parent channel.
note: only available for newly created or writable file.

member.param: [in] name name for the sub channel.

param.name: relativeByteOffset
param.para: [in] relativeByteOffset byte offset of the channel value in the data bytes of the parent channel.
Note: the byte offset within the record of the channel group will be calculated internally!

member.param: [in] bitCount (default value = 64) number of bits used for the channel value in the record data bytes.

param.name: channelDataType
param.para: [in] dataType (default value = eReal_LE) data type of the channel
If number of bits does not match the data type, the method will fail with error code eInvalidDataTypeSize.

member.param: [in] comment (default value = null) object of type IComment to set for the channel. Note: object must be in same file and if comment is XML for MDF4, it should match the respective XML schema (cn_comment.XSD).
[in] unit (default value = null) object of type IUnit to set for the channel. Note: object must be in same file and if unit is XML for MDF4, it should match the respective XML schema (cn_unit.XSD).
[in] conversion (default value = null) object of type IConversion to set for the channel. Note: object must be in same file and the conversion type must match the channel data type.

param.name: flags
param.para: [in] flags bit flags to set for the channel
Note: flags eFlagPrecisionValid, eFlagValueRangeValid, eFlagLimitRangeValid, eFlagLimitExtRangeValid and eFlagDefaultX will be ignored (reset)
use the respective Set methods instead to set the information.

member.param: [in] invalBitPos (default value = 0) position of invalidation bit. Will only be considered for MDF4 and if eFlagInvalBitUsed flag is set in flags.
[in] bitOffset (default value = 0) bit offset of the channel value in the data bytes of the parent channel. 0-7, must be 0 for all data types >= eReal_LE.
[out] errorCode contains the error code of the operation
member.returns: on success the IChannel interface of the created master channel, otherwise null

member.name: M:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.IChannel.IsEncodedInChannelGroup(Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.IChannelGroup,Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.ErrorCode@)

summary.para: Request if the values for this channel are encoded in the record of given channel group

note: for array elements it can happen that a channel is part of the channel set retrieved for a channel group, although its values are not encoded in the record of this channel group (e.g. CG/DG template for MDF4 or CD block elements distributed over several CGs for MDF3).
In this case use the IDataPointer returned by IChannel::CreateDataPointer of the channel instead of the one returned by IChannelGroup::CreateDataPointer

member.param: [in] channelGroup the channel group to check
[out] errorCode contains the error code of the operation
member.returns: true if channel value is in the record of given channel group, false otherwise or on error

member.name: M:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.IChannel.ReadValueRange(System.Double@,System.Double@)

summary.para: Read value range of channel
The minimum and maximum value that occurred for a signal can be stored, e.g.
for quick determination of the display range or statistics.
For arrays, the minimum and maximum value is calculated over all elements.

Note: for MDF4 the precision can be specified directly for the channel. This overrules a precision provided via conversion rule. For MDF3, the precision is stored in the channel comment (Vector proprietary extension).

para.para: Note: the range may not be valid

member.param: [out] the minimum raw value of the range will be assigned
[out] the maximum raw value of the range will be assigned
member.returns: error code of the operation

member.name: M:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.IChannel.GetPrecision(System.Boolean,Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.ErrorCode@)

summary.para: Request the precision to use for display of floating point values

Note: for MDF4 the precision can be specified directly for the channel. This overrules a precision provided via conversion rule. For MDF3, the precision is stored in the channel comment (Vector proprietary extension).
Note: the precision information is optional

member.param: [in] channelOnly if false and if the channel has no precision information, the precision information of the conversion rule will be returned as fall-back. Otherwise only the precision information of the channel will be considered.
[out] errorCode contains the error code of the operation
member.returns: number of decimal places to use for display of floating point values or 255 (0xFF) in case of error or unrestricted precision

member.name: M:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.IChannel.GetUnit(System.Boolean)
member.summary: For details please refer to overloaded method

member.name: M:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.IChannel.GetUnit(System.Boolean,Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.ErrorCode@)

summary.para: Get unit of channel

Note: for MDF4 a unit can be specified directly for the channel. This overrules a unit provided via conversion rule. For MDF3, a unit only can be specified via conversion rule. Thus, for MDF3 parameter channelOnly = false can be used to get the unit from the conversion rule instead.
Note: for MDF4 channel data types eMimeSample and eMimeStream, the IUnit of the channel contains the MIME type text (given by IUnit::GetName)

member.param: [in] channelOnly if false and if the channel has no unit, the unit of the conversion rule will be returned as fall-back. Otherwise only the unit for channel will be considered.
[out] errorCode contains the error code of the operation
member.returns: pointer to IUnit object, null on error or if not available

member.name: M:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.IAttachment.SetMimeType(System.String)
member.summary:
Set or change the mime type of the attachment
note: only available for newly created or writable file, not available for MDF3
member.param: [in] mime type string to be set, null to delete the mime type.
member.returns: error code of the operation

member.name: M:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.IAttachment.SetFilePath(System.String)
member.summary:
Set or change the file path of the attachment
note: only available for newly created or writable file, not available for MDF3 A file path either is absolute or relative to the path of the MDF file. Note that after changing the file path, the MD5 check sum may become invalid (possibly call UpdateCheckSumMD5 or SetCheckSumMD5)
note: For embedded attachments the file name is optional. If given, it usually represents the name of the original file.
member.param: [in] file path to be set, null to delete the file path (only allowed for embedded attachments)
member.returns: error code of the operation

member.name: M:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.IAttachment.SetCheckSumMD5(System.Byte[],System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Set the MD5 checksum for the attachment
note: only available for newly created or writable file, not available for MDF3 This method can be used to set or change the checksum of an attachment, e.g. if it has been calculated before. It also allows to reset (invalidate) the checksum. Please make sure that the checksum is correct!
member.param: [in] 16 Byte buffer for the 128-bit value for MD5 checksum (of the uncompressed data if data is embedded and compressed)
[in] isValid true if the checksum is valid, false if the checksum should be invalidated
member.returns: error code of the operation

member.name: M:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.IAttachment.UpdateCheckSumMD5(Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.IProgressCallback)
member.summary:
Calculate and update the MD5 checksum for the attachment
note: only available for newly created or writable file, not available for MDF3
note: for embedded compressed data, the checksum is calculated for the uncompressed data!
member.param: [in] for large attachments, this operation may take some time. For feedback (e.g. progress bar), a IProgressCallback interface pointer may be given which receives the progress feedback and which may also be used to cancel the operation
member.returns: error code of the operation

member.name: M:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.IAttachment.SetComment(Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.IComment)
member.summary:
Set comment of attachment
note: only available for newly created or writable file, not available for MDF3
member.param: [in] pointer to IComment object, null to remove reference to comment object. Note: object must be in same file and if comment is XML for MDF4, it should match the respective XML schema (at_comment.XSD).
member.returns: error code for the operation

member.name: M:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.IAttachment.GetFilePath
member.summary: For details please refer to overloaded method

member.name: M:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.IAttachment.GetFilePath(Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.ErrorCode@)
member.summary:
Get file path of attachment
The file path is determined by using the file name relative to the path of the MDF file
note: For embedded attachments the file name is optional. If given, usually represents the name of the original file.
member.param: [out] the error code of the operation will be returned
member.returns: pointer to string with file path, null on error

member.summary:
Calculate the MD5 checksum for the attachment
note: for embedded compressed data, the checksum is calculated for the uncompressed data!

member.name: M:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.IAttachment.SaveToFile(System.String,System.Boolean,Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.IProgressCallback)
member.summary:
Save the attachment to a file
note: be careful not to overwrite existing file (see argument overwrite)

member.returns: error code of the operation

member.name: M:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.IAttachment.GetPtr
member.summary: Used to get underlying C++ pointer

member.name: T:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.IAttachment
member.summary:
Attachment of the MDF file (external or embedded)
An attachment is a file that is either included in the MDF file as embedded attachment or that is referenced as external attachment. Attachments were introduced with MDF4.
For MDF3, a program block (PR block) is the equivalent of an embedded attachment. There can be only one single PR block for an MDF3 file. The MDF4Lib will model it as single attachment, however no MIME type or other information will be available.
You may also read the binary data of an attachment (embedded or external), or save the attachment to a file on hard disk.

member.name: T:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.CommentMergeFlags
member.summary: Control of merging of comment information used by IFile::SetCommentTextAndFields and IFactory::CreateCommentEx

member.name: F:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.CommentMergeFlags.eKeepExstingInformationAppendText
member.summary: Combination of several options to keep existing information AND append text (separated by line break)

member.name: F:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.CommentMergeFlags.eKeepExstingInformation
member.summary: Combination of several options to keep existing information (used as Default)

member.name: F:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.CommentMergeFlags.eUpdateCreatorInformation
member.summary: If set, creator information (ci attributes) are updated for all element in input XML string. This flag should be set in case the input XML string originates from a different file. Only relevant for IFactory::CreateCommentEx if isXml is true.

member.name: F:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.CommentMergeFlags.ePreserveAdditionalInformation
member.summary: If set, additional information in the original comment will be preserved (i.e. $-encoded information in MDF 3.x that is not mapped to comment fields or additional XML information in MDF 4.x). Otherwise, the additional information will be removed.

member.name: F:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.CommentMergeFlags.eAppendTextWithLineBreak
member.summary: If set and if ::eAppendCommentText is set and if the orginal text is not empty, then a line break (\n) will be inserted before appending the plainText

member.name: F:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.CommentMergeFlags.eAppendCommentText
member.summary: If set, and if plain comment text is given (plainText != nullptr), the text will be appended to an existing text. If not set, and if plaingText is not null, the original text will be replaced. See also ::eAppendTextWithLineBreak

member.name: F:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.CommentMergeFlags.eRemoveCommentFields
member.summary: If set, and if list of comment fields is given, all fields specified in the list will be removed from the existing fields; all other fields are preserved. This flag cannot be set together with ::eMergeCommentFields.

member.name: F:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.CommentMergeFlags.eMergeCommentFields
member.summary: If set, and if list of comment fields is given, replace existing fields and append new fields. If not set, and if list of comment fields is given, existing fields are removed and the new fields are written. If comment fields are not given, existing fields are always preserved.

member.name: F:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.CommentMergeFlags.eCommentMergeFlagsUnspecified
member.summary: Unspecified, i.e. no flag is set

tree node, represents a <tree> tag (available in MDF 4.0 or higher).

Data type of a comment field used in structure IMDF4LibStructs::FieldProperties

member.name: T:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.SyntaxVersion
member.summary:
Syntax version for algebraic formula. used for IFactory::CreateAlgebraicConversionEx.
Note: Most operators are equal in both syntax versions, but some have a different meaning or a different notation. For instance, ^ is used for "bitwise exclusive OR" in MDF4 whereas it previously was used as power operator in MDF3.
For all differences, please refer to ASAM MCD 2MC 1.6.0 specification, section "Incompatibility of keyword FORMULA".

member.name: F:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.SyntaxVersion.eSyntaxVersionMDF4
member.summary: Syntax for MDF4 (ASAP2 V 1.6 / ASAM GES 1.0)

member.name: F:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.SyntaxVersion.eSyntaxVersionMDF3
member.summary: Syntax for MDF3 (ASAP2 V 1.5)

member.name: F:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.SyntaxVersion.eSyntaxVersionUnspec
member.summary: Unspecified. In this case, the formula is used "as is", i.e. it is assumed that it is correct for the current MDF version.

member.name: T:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.ArrayPropertyFlags
member.summary: Bit flags for array properties enum values are equal to MDF4 bit positions for ca_flags

member.name: F:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.ArrayPropertyFlags.eHasLeftOpenInterval
member.summary: If set, the interval ranges for the class interval axes are left-open and right-closed, i.e. [a,b] = {x | a < x <= b}. If not set, the interval ranges for the class interval axes are left-closed and right-open, i.e. [a,b] = {x | a <= x < b}. Only relevant for array type ::eIsIntervalAxis

member.name: F:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.ArrayPropertyFlags.eHasInverseLayout
member.summary: If set, the record layout is "column oriented" instead of "row oriented". Only of the number of dimensions is more than 1.

member.name: F:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.ArrayPropertyFlags.eHasFixedAxis
member.summary: If set, the scaling axis is fixed and the axis points are stored directly in the IArrayInfo (IArrayInfo::GetFixAxisRawValues / IArrayInfo::SetFixAxisRawValues). If not set, the scaling axis may vary over time and the axis points are stored as channel for each dimension (IArrayInfo::GetAxisChannel / IArrayInfo::SetAxisChannel). Only relevant if ::eHasAxis is set. Can only not be set for array types ::eIsLookUp and ::eIsScalingAxis.

member.name: F:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.ArrayPropertyFlags.eHasAxis
member.summary: If set, a scaling axis can be given for each dimension of the array, either as fixed or as dynamic axis, depending on ::eHasFixedAxis flag. Can only be set for array types ::eIsLookUp, ::eIsScalingAxis and ::eIsClassificationResult.

member.name: F:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.ArrayPropertyFlags.eHasComparisonQuantity
member.summary: If set, a channel for the comparison quantity can be specified (IArrayInfo::GetComparisonQuantityChannel / IArrayInfo::SetComparisonQuantityChannel). Can only be set for array types ::eIsLookUp.

member.name: F:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.ArrayPropertyFlags.eHasOutputQuantity
member.summary: If set, a channel for the output quantity can be specified (IArrayInfo::GetOutputQuantityChannel / IArrayInfo::SetOutputQuantityChannel). Can only be set for array types ::eIsLookUp.

member.name: F:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.ArrayPropertyFlags.eHasInputQuantity
member.summary: If set, a channel for the input quantity can be specified for each dimension. In this case each dimension can have an input quantity signal (IArrayInfo::GetInputQuantityChannel / IArrayInfo::SetInputQuantityChannel). Can only be set for array types ::eIsLookUp and ::eIsScalingAxis.

member.name: F:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.ArrayPropertyFlags.eHasDynamicSize
member.summary: If set, the number of scaling points for the array is not fixed but can vary over time. In this case each dimension can have a size signal (IArrayInfo::GetDynamicSizeChannel / IArrayInfo::SetDynamicSizeChannel). Can only be set for array types ::eIsLookUp and ::eIsScalingAxis.

member.name: F:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.ArrayPropertyFlags.eArrayPropertyUnspecified
member.summary: Unspecified, i.e. no flag is set

member.name: T:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.ArrayType
member.summary: MDF channel array type enum values are equal to MDF4 enum values for ca_type

member.name: F:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.ArrayType.eIsClassificationResult
member.summary: The array is a D-dimensional array containing classification results. It can have scaling axes (::eIsScalingAxis) or interval axes (::eIsIntervalAxis), even mixed. This type is not valid for MDF < 4.1

member.name: F:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.ArrayType.eIsIntervalAxis
member.summary: The array is an axis (1-dimensional vector) defining interval ranges as "axis points". It can be referenced by one or more arrays of type ::eIsClassificationResult. In contrast to a scaling axis (::eIsScalingAxis), an interval axis always has one element more than the number of elements for the respective dimension of the classification result array which references it. The elements of the class interval axis define the borders of interval ranges that are seen as axis points. Depending on the ::eHasLeftOpenInterval flag, the intervals are defined as left-open/right-closed or left-closed/right-open. This type is not valid for MDF < 4.1

member.name: F:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.ArrayType.eIsLookUp
member.summary: The array is a D-dimensional array with axes. It can have input/output/comparison quantities.

member.name: F:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.ArrayType.eIsScalingAxis
member.summary: The array is a scaling axis (1-dimensional vector), possibly referenced by one or more arrays. If referenced by an array of type ::eIsLookUp, the axis itself may have a scaling axis (e.g. for a "curve axis") and an own input quantity.

member.name: F:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.ArrayType.eIsValueArray
member.summary: The array is a simple D-dimensional value array (value block) without axes and without input/output/comparison quantities.

member.name: F:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.ArrayType.eArrayTypeUnspec
member.summary: Unspecified

member.name: T:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.LimitType
member.summary: Limit type used for IFile::SetLimit

member.name: F:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.LimitType.eTotalSizeOfBuffer
member.summary: Maximum size to be used for all read and write buffers of this file. The default size for this buffer type is 64 MByte.

member.name: F:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.LimitType.eLimitTypeUnspec
member.summary: Unspecified

summary.para: Bit flags for options when checking if channel values can be safely read
used by IDataPoiner::CanReadChannelValueAsPhysDouble

member.name: F:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.CanReadChannelValueFlags.eCheckMultiReadUseCase
member.summary: If set, the check will be executed especially for MultiRead use case, otherwise only for ordinary Read use case.

member.name: F:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.CanReadChannelValueFlags.eCanReadChannelValueFlagsDefault
member.summary: Default means no option flags are present.

summary.para: Bit flags for options when creating an IDataPointer object
used by IChannelGroup::CreateDataPointerEx and IChannel::CreateDataPointerEx

member.name: F:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.DataPointerOptionsFlags.eShowVerbalTableErrorForMultiRead
member.summary:
If set, MultiReadPhysValueDouble methods will return error code ::eDifferentCoversionResultType if one of the channels has a verbal table that returns a string (unless ::eDisableVerbalTableError is specified)
Note: the option was introduced for backward compatibility since this error has not been reported by MultiReadPhysValueDouble methods before.

member.name: F:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.DataPointerOptionsFlags.eDisableVerbalTableError
member.summary: If set, ::eDifferentCoversionResultType will be ignored / not returned by ReadPhysValueDouble and all MultiReadPhysValueDouble methods and the numeric raw value will be used as phys value

member.name: F:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.DataPointerOptionsFlags.eDisableStatusTabWarning
member.summary: If set, ::eStatusStringTableEntry will be ignored/not returned by ReadPhysValueDouble and all MultiReadPhysValueDouble methods and the numeric raw value will be used as phys value

member.name: F:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.DataPointerOptionsFlags.eDisableAutoRestorePos
member.summary: If set, the automatic restoration of the record position after a MultiRead operation will be disabled

member.name: F:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.DataPointerOptionsFlags.eUseAutoIncrement
member.summary: If set, the eAutoIncrement read mode will be activated immediately

member.name: F:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.DataPointerOptionsFlags.eUseReadBuffer
member.summary: If set, the IDataPointer will use a read buffer for reading the records (if possible). If not set, the records are read directly from file (less memory consumption, but possibly slower). See also IFile::SetLimit. This is especially useful when using the MultRead methods or for simple forward reading all all records.

member.name: F:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.DataPointerOptionsFlags.eDataPointerOptionsFlagsDefault
member.summary: Default means no option flags are present.

member.name: F:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.RewriteFileOptionFlags.eOverwriteRewriteFile
member.summary: If set, an existing destination file will be overwritten. If not set and if destination file exists, the operation will fail.

member.name: F:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.RewriteFileOptionFlags.eRewriteFileOptionUnspecified

member.name: F:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.ValidateFileOptionFlags.eCheckUnfinalized
member.summary: If set, validation will also be done for unfinalized MDF files. Otherwise unfinalized MDF files are rejected (error code ::eUnfinalizedMdf).

member.name: F:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.ValidateFileOptionFlags.eCheckXmlFragments
member.summary: If set, validation will check for valid XML fragments (MDF 4.x only). Attention: XML fragments can only be checked if the respective Schema files are present in subfolder Schema/v4xx. In case one of the Unicode variants of MDF4 Lib is used, the non-Unicode variant of XmlParser DLL is required in addition.

member.name: F:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.ValidateFileOptionFlags.eCheckForGaps
member.summary: If set, validation will check for gaps and overlapping of blocks.

member.name: F:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.ValidateFileOptionFlags.eReportWarnings
member.summary: If set, warnings are reported, too. Otherwise only errors are reported.

member.name: F:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.ValidateFileOptionFlags.eValidateFileOptionUnspecified
member.summary: Unspecified, i.e. no flag is set

member.name: F:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.FinalizeFileOptionFlags.eTestFinalizationMode
member.summary: If set, the file will not be finalized immediately but only tested if it is unfinalized and if it is possible to finalize it.

member.name: F:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.FinalizeFileOptionFlags.eAlwaysSortFile
member.summary: If set, an unsorted (and unfinalized) file will be sorted during finalization, independent if sorting is necessary for finalization or not.

member.name: F:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.FinalizeFileOptionFlags.eOverwriteDestFile
member.summary: If set, an existing destination file will be overwritten. If not set and if destination file exists, the operation will fail.

member.name: F:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.FinalizeFileOptionFlags.eFinalizeFileOptionUnspecified

member.summary: If set, writing to file will be done asynchronously

member.summary: If set, an existing destination file will be overwritten. If not set and if destination file exists, the operation will fail.

member.name: T:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.SortFileOptionFlags
member.summary: Bit flags for options of MDF sorting used by IFileManager::SortFile

member.name: F:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.SortFileOptionFlags.eCheckTime
member.summary: If set, reverse time stamps detected during sorting are treated as error.

member.name: F:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.SortFileOptionFlags.eDebugLogSink
member.summary: If set, all output messages for debug logging of MdfSort will be sent to the log sinks registered for IFileManager.

summary.para: If set, debug logging is activated. A log file will be generated for the sort operation: Default is to create a new log file with the same path and base name of destination file with postfix "_MdfSort_log.txt" appended, e.g. "A.mdf" => "A_MdfSort_log.txt".
If output file is not specified or output dir is not valid, then the path and name of the MdfSort.DLL will be used with postfix "_log.txt", e.g. "MdfSort_log.txt".
If set, the file will not be sorted immediately but only tested if it requires sorting
Note: currently for MDF4 files, arrays with CG template are not considered/supported yet!

member.name: F:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.SortFileOptionFlags.eFixMdf3GapRecords
member.summary: If set, gaps in an MDF3 file will be closed during sorting if there are missing records (cycle counter too high e.g. when saving records failed due to full disk)

member.name: F:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.SortFileOptionFlags.eFixMdf3AddRecords
member.summary: If set, an MDF3 file will be corrected during sorting if there are additional records (cycle counter too small / missing update e.g. due to a crash)

member.name: F:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.SortFileOptionFlags.eOverwriteDestinationFile
member.summary: If set, an existing destination file will be overwritten. If not set and if destination file exists, the operation will fail.

member.name: F:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.SortFileOptionFlags.eSortFileOptionUnspecified
member.summary: Unspecified, i.e. no flag is set

member.name: F:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.SeekTimeMode.eSeekEqual
member.summary: Seek time position that is equal

member.name: F:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.SeekTimeMode.eSeekNearest
member.summary: Seek time position that is nearest (can be less or greater)

member.name: T:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.FlushCheckMode
member.summary: Modes for IDataWriter if to check for flush errors (no dirty bits set)

member.name: F:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.FlushCheckMode.eFlushCheckAll
member.summary: combination of eFlushCheckDuringFlush and eFlushCheckDuringWrite

summary.para: check during Write/SetTime methods and returns eNoFlushSinceLastValue in case a value has been written before and omits writing the value again.
The only exception is WriteRecord: this method may also report eNoFlushSinceLastValue, but the record will be written nevertheless, thus overwriting previously set values.
for write mode eAutoFlush, the automatic flush during Write/SetTime fails if not all channels are "dirty".
For calling IDataWriter::FlushRecord directly, the method returns eFlushNotAllValuesWritten as warning in case not all values have been written before, but reocrd is wirtten nevertheless!

member.name: F:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.FlushCheckMode.eFlushCheckDisabled
member.summary: no check for flush errors

member.name: T:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.TimeCheckMode
member.summary: Modes for IDataWriter if and when to check for reverse time stamps

member.name: F:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.TimeCheckMode.eTimeCheckDuringSetTime
member.summary: check during SetTime methods (returns eReverseTimeStamp in case of reverse time stamps, but time value is written nevertheless!)

member.name: F:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.TimeCheckMode.eTimeCheckDuringFlush
member.summary: check during FlushRecord/WriteRecord (returns eReverseTimeStamp in case of reverse time stamps, but record is written nevertheless!)

member.name: F:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.TimeCheckMode.eTimeCheckDisabled
member.summary: no check for reverse time stamps

member.name: T:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.DataWriteMode
member.summary: Modes for IDataWriter::Write methods

member.name: F:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.DataWriteMode.eAutoFlush
member.summary: If SetTime, WriteRecord or Write operation for a channel is called a second time for the current record, the current record will be written (flushed) to file, a new record will be prepared and the Write operation will set the value in the new record. This allows subsequentually writing all values for a channel (or a number of channels).

member.name: F:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.DataWriteMode.eSetValue
member.summary: Write operation will set/change the value in the current record

member.name: T:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.DataReadMode
member.summary: Modes for IDataPointer::Read methods

member.name: F:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.DataReadMode.eAutoIncrement
member.summary: If Read operation for a channel is called a second time for the current record, the next record will be read and the Read operation will return the value from the newly read record. This allows subsequentually reading all values for a channel (or a number of channels).

member.name: F:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.DataReadMode.eGetValue
member.summary: Read operation will return the value from the current record

member.name: T:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.OpenFileMode
member.summary: Modes for OpenFile

member.name: F:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.OpenFileMode.eReadWriteExclusive
member.summary: Read and write access, locking the file. This allows to modify (extend) an exising MDF file. Only usable with extended licensing of MDF4 Lib ("write option").

member.name: F:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.OpenFileMode.eReadShare
member.summary: Read only access, with sharing

member.name: F:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.OpenFileMode.eReadExclusive
member.summary: Read only access, locking the file

summary.para: Bit flags of a time stamp

member.name: F:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.TimeFlags.eFlagOffsetsValid
member.summary: If set, the time zone and DST offsets are valid.

member.summary: If set, the start time stamp in nanoseconds represents the local time instead of the UTC time. In this case, time zone and DST offset must not be considered.

member.name: F:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.TimeFlags.eTimeFlagsUnspecified
member.summary: Unspecified, i.e. no flag is set

member.summary: If set, the at_md5_checksum field contains the MD5 check sum of the data.

member.name: F:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.AttachmentFlags.eFlagCompressed

member.name: T:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.ChannelSubSetFilterFlags
member.summary: Bit flags to filter channels used by GetChannelSubSet methods

summary.para: If set, for the IChannelSet result each call to IChannelSet::GetChannelName uses a binary search.
This flag can be used to improve performance in case several calls to GetChannelName are expected.
Note that the first call to GetChannelName takes longer since the channels must be sorted according to the channel names first.

member.name: F:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.ChannelSubSetFilterFlags.eCompareNoCase
member.summary: If set, the name comparison is not done case sensitive

member.name: F:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.ChannelSubSetFilterFlags.eUseNamePrefixAsMask
member.summary: If set, the name prefix is treated as search mask with wild cards. The wildcards can be ? (question mark character) for any single character and * (asterisk character) for any number of various characters.

member.name: F:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.ChannelSubSetFilterFlags.eUseChannelNameAsMask
member.summary: If set, the name is treated as search mask with wild cards. The wildcards can be ? (question mark character) for any single character and * (asterisk character) for any number of various characters.

member.name: F:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.ChannelSubSetFilterFlags.eAcceptIfNoExtension
member.summary: If set, channels without an extended name prefix are accepted even if parameter extendedNamePrefix is specified.

member.name: F:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.ChannelSubSetFilterFlags.eSubSetFilterFlagsUnspecified
member.summary: Unspecified, i.e. no flag is set

member.name: T:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.ChannelFilterFlags
member.summary: Bit flags to filter channels used by GetChannelSet methods

member.name: F:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.ChannelFilterFlags.eAllChannels
member.summary: bit combination to get all channels, i.e. including master channels

member.name: F:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.ChannelFilterFlags.eAllDataChannels
member.summary: bit combination to get all "data" channels, i.e. without master channels

summary.para: If set, for the IChannelSet result each call to IChannelSet::GetChannelName uses a binary search.
This flag can be used to improve performance in case several calls to GetChannelName are expected.
Note that the first call to GetChannelName takes longer since the channels must be sorted according to the channel names first.
If set, channels are excluded if flag eFlagBusEvent is not set (MDF 4.1 bus logging)
eExcludeNonBusEventChannels and eExcludeBusEvents must not be set together!

member.name: F:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.ChannelFilterFlags.eExcludeBusEventChannels
member.summary: If set, channels are excluded if flag eFlagBusEvent is set (MDF 4.1 bus logging)

member.name: F:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.ChannelFilterFlags.eIncludeChildsRecursively
member.summary: If set, the flags eIncludeChildStructMembers and eIncludeChildArrayElements will be applied recursively

member.name: F:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.ChannelFilterFlags.eIncludeChildArrayElements
member.summary: If set, child channels of arrays will be included in the set

member.name: F:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.ChannelFilterFlags.eIncludeChildStructMembers
member.summary: If set, child channels of structures will be included in the set

member.name: F:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.ChannelFilterFlags.eIncludeMasterChannels
member.summary: If set, master channels will be included in the set, otherwise only value channels are included

member.name: F:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.ChannelFilterFlags.eChannelFilterFlagsUnspecified
member.summary: Default value, i.e. no flag is set

enum values are equal to MDF4 bit positions for cn_flags

member.summary: If set, the values for this channel are strictly monotonously increasing/decreasing (introduced in MDF 4.1)

member.name: F:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.EventFilterFlags.eAcceptIfNoEventName
member.summary: If set, events without name are accepted in case a name filter is given, otherwise they are excluded. Only relevant for GetEventSubSet method and if the eventName is not null.

member.summary: If set, the name comparison is not done case sensitive. Only relevant for GetEventSubSet method and if the eventName is not null.

member.name: F:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.EventFilterFlags.eUseEventNameAsMask
member.summary: If set, the name is treated as search mask with wild cards. Only relevant for GetEventSubSet method and if the eventName is not null. The wildcards can be ? (question mark character) for any single character and * (asterisk character) for any number of various characters.

member.name: F:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.EventFilterFlags.eOnlyPostProcessingEvents
member.summary: If set, only events marked as "post processing" event are included (mutual exclusive with ::eExcludePostProcessingEvents)

member.name: F:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.EventFilterFlags.eExcludeEventsWithGlobalScope
member.summary: If set, events with global scope are excluded (mutual exclusive with ::eOnlyEventsWithGlobalScope)

member.name: F:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.EventFilterFlags.eOnlyEventsWithGlobalScope
member.summary: If set, only events with global scope are included (mutual exclusive with ::eOnlyEventsWithGlobalScope)

member.name: F:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.EventFilterFlags.eIncludeAllEventTypes
member.summary: if none of the Include flags for an event type is set, all event types are included automatically. same for eIncludeEventsWithSyncTypeXXX flags: if none of these flags is set, all synchronization types are included. same for eIncludeEventsWithEventCauseXXX flags: if none of these flags is set, all event causes are included.

summary.para: MDF event type
enum values are equal to MDF4 enum values for ev_type

member.name: F:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.EventType.eMarker
member.summary: This event type specifies a marker for a point or a range.

member.name: F:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.EventType.eTrigger
member.summary: This event type generally specifies an event that occurred due to some condition (except of the special start and stop recording trigger event types).

member.name: F:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.EventType.eStopRecordingTrigger
member.summary: Symmetrically to the "start recording trigger" event type, this event type specifies an event which stopped the recording of signal values due to some condition.

member.name: F:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.EventType.eStartRecordingTrigger
member.summary: This event type specifies an event which started the recording of signal values due to some condition

member.name: F:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.EventType.eAcquisitionInterrupt
member.summary: This event type indicates that not only the recording, but already the acquisition of the signal values has been interrupted.

member.name: F:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.EventType.eRecordingInterrupt
member.summary: This event type indicates that the recording has been interrupted.

member.name: F:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.EventType.eRecording
member.summary: This event type specifies a recording period, i.e. the first and last time a signal value could theoretically be recorded.

member.name: F:Vector.Mdf4LibDotNet.EventType.eEventTypeUnspec
member.summary: Unspecified
